metadata.title: CVE-2021-20271 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPM's signature check functionality when reading apackage file. This flaw allows an attacker who can convince a victim toinstall a seemingly verifiable package, whose signature header wasmodified, to cause RPM database corruption and execute code. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to data integrity, confidentiality, andsystem availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20271` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

debugedit - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpm3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmbuild3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmio3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmsign3 - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-rpm - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-rpm - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm-common - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm-i18n - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm2cpio - 4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: rpm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.12.0.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
